articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iranians will choose between mostly hardline candidates in an early presidential election on Friday following the death of Ebrahim Raisi in a helicopter crash.
articles.title: Who in Iran seeks the presidency after Raisi's death?

articles.author: Helen Coster, James Oliphant, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Democratic President Joe Biden and his Republican rival Donald Trump take the stage on Thursday night for a debate that will offer voters a rare side-by-side look at the two oldest candidates ever to seek the U.S. presidency.
articles.title: Biden and Trump face off in early debate, with age, ability in focus

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iranians will vote for a new president on Friday following Ebrahim Raisi's death in a helicopter crash, choosing from a tightly controlled group of four candidates loyal to the supreme leader, at a time of growing public frustration.
articles.title: Iran holds presidential vote with limited choices

articles.author: Gleb Stolyarov
articles.description: Laughing and joking, Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un cruised around Pyongyang last week in a Russian-made Aurus limousine to showcase their strengthened anti-Western alliance.
articles.title: Exclusive: Firm making car that Putin gifted to Kim uses South Korean parts, data shows

articles.author: Monica Machicao, Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Bolivian President Luis Arce on Thursday denied any involvement or prior knowledge of a failed coup attempt led by the country's former top military commander who alleged the president had asked him to do something to boost his popularity.
articles.title: Bolivia president denies prior intelligence of coup planning

articles.author: Aaron Ross, Giulia Paravicini
articles.description: After their stunning success forcing the government to shelve $2.7 billion in tax hikes, young Kenyan activists are setting their sights higher, taking aim at deeply ingrained corruption and misgovernance.
articles.title: After dramatic tax win, Kenyan protesters plot next moves

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Another child died of malnutrition in northern Gaza overnight and six people were killed and several wounded in renewed Israeli bombing of residential areas of Gaza City, Palestinian health officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: Girl dies of malnutrition in Gaza as Israel bombs north and south

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States will confront Russia at the United Nations Security Council on Friday over violating a North Korea arms embargo, and will push for China's view on growing ties between Moscow and Pyongyang, said deputy U.S. Ambassador Robert Wood.
articles.title: US to confront Russia at UN over North Korean weapons

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: The number of days reaching a sizzling 35 degrees Celsius (95 Fahrenheit) in 20 of the world's largest capitals - from Delhi to Jakarta to Buenos Aires - has risen 52% over the past three decades, a think tank analysis found on Friday.
articles.title: Number of days over 35 C surges in world's scorching capitals

articles.author: Tim Reid, Gram Slattery
articles.description: A group of U.S. voters who were unable to choose between Joe Biden and Donald Trump before Thursday's presidential debate delivered their verdicts after the contest and it was almost universally bad news for Biden.
articles.title: US presidential debate: what do undecided voters think?
